title: Covariance-aware Feature Alignment with Pre-computed Source Statistics for Test-time Adaptation to Multiple Image Corruptions. (arXiv:2204.13263v2 [cs.LG] UPDATED)
abstract: Real-world image recognition systems often face corrupted input images, which cause distribution shifts and degrade the performance of models. These systems often use a single prediction model in a central server and process images sent from various environments, such as cameras distributed in cities or cars. Such single models face images corrupted in heterogeneous ways in test time. Thus, they require to instantly adapt to the multiple corruptions during testing rather than being re-trained at a high cost. Test-time adaptation (TTA), which aims to adapt models without accessing the training dataset, is one of the settings that can address this problem. Existing TTA methods indeed work well on a single corruption. However, the adaptation ability is limited when multiple types of corruption occur, which is more realistic. tldr: 本文提出了一种使用预计算源统计数据的协方差感知的特征对齐方法，用于对多种图像污染进行测试时间自适应。现有的测试时间自适应方法在面对多种污染时的适应能力有限。本文通过解决复杂的分布偏移问题，提高了对多种污染的自适应能力。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a covariance-aware feature alignment method with pre-computed source statistics for test-time adaptation to multiple image corruptions. Existing test-time adaptation methods have limited adaptation ability when facing multiple corruptions. This paper improves the adaptation ability to multiple corruptions by addressing the complex distribution shift problem.
